"Help": "Demand data read requests that missed L3."

"Help": "Perf subsystem metric scaling factor
"Unit": max value of all perf per task metrics."

Name: task_scaling_factor_max
"Help": "Perf subsystem metric scaling factor
"Unit": max value of all perf per task metrics."

Name: task_ips
"Help": "Instructions per second."

Name: task_ipc
"Help": "Instructions per cycle."

Name: task_cache_hit_ratio
"Help": "Cache hit ratio

Name: task_cache_misses_per_kilo_instructions
"Help": "Cache misses per kilo instructions."

"Help": "LLC occupancy from resctrl filesystem based on Intel RDT technology."

Name: task_mem_bandwidth_bytes
"Help": "Total memory bandwidth using Memory Bandwidth Monitoring."

Name: task_mem_bandwidth_local_bytes
"Help": "Total local memory bandwidth using Memory Bandwidth Monitoring."

Name: task_mem_bandwidth_remote_bytes
"Help": "Total remote memory bandwidth using Memory Bandwidth Monitoring."

Name: task_cpu_usage_seconds
"Help": "Time taken by task based on cpuacct.usage (total kernel and user space)."

Name: task_mem_usage_bytes
"Help": "Memory usage_in_bytes per tasks returned from cgroup memory subsystem."

Name: task_mem_max_usage_bytes
"Help": "Memory max_usage_in_bytes per tasks returned from cgroup memory subsystem."

Name: task_mem_limit_bytes
"Help": "Memory limit_in_bytes per tasks returned from cgroup memory subsystem."

Name: task_mem_soft_limit_bytes
"Help": "Memory soft_limit_in_bytes per tasks returned from cgroup memory subsystem."

Name: task_mem_numa_pages
"Help": "Number of used pages per NUMA node(key: hierarchical_total is used if available or justtotal with warning)
"Unit": from cgroup memory controller from memory.numa_stat file."

Name: task_mem_page_faults
"Help": "Number of page faults for task."

Name: task_wss_referenced_bytes
"Help": "Task referenced bytes during last measurements cycle based on /proc/smaps Referenced field
"Unit": with /proc/PIDs/clear_refs set to 1 accordinn wss_reset_interval.Warning: this is intrusive collection
"Type": because can influence kernel page reclaim policy and add latency.Refer to https://github.com/brendangregg/wss#wsspl-referenced-page-flag for more details."

Name: task_requested_cpus
"Help": "Tasks resources cpus initial requests."

Name: task_requested_mem_bytes
"Help": "Tasks resources memory initial requests."

Name: task_last_seen
"Help": "Time the task was last seen."

Name: platform_topology_cores
"Help": "Platform information about number of physical cores"

Name: platform_topology_cpus
"Help": "Platform information about number of logical cpus"

Name: platform_topology_sockets
"Help": "Platform information about number of sockets"

Name: platform_dimm_count
"Help": "Number of RAM DIMM (all types memory modules)"

Name: platform_dimm_total_size_bytes
"Help": "Total RAM size (all types memory modules)"

Name: platform_mem_mode_size_bytes
"Help": "Size of RAM (Persistent memory) configured in memory mode."

Name: platform_cpu_usage
"Help": "Logical CPU usage in 1/USER_HZ (usually 10ms).Calculated using values based on /proc/stat."

Name: platform_mem_usage_bytes
"Help": "Total memory used by platform in bytes based on /proc/meminfo and uses heuristic based on linux free tool (total - free - buffers - cache)."

Name: platform_mem_numa_free_bytes
"Help": "NUMA memory free per NUMA node based on /sys/devices/system/node/* (MemFree:)"

Name: platform_mem_numa_used_bytes
"Help": "NUMA memory free per NUMA used based on /sys/devices/system/node/* (MemUsed:)"
